instance.context:
These facilitators are not always subject
experts , and attempt to draw on the existing knowledge of the participant(s ) , and to then facilitate access to training where gaps in knowledge are identified and agreed on . Training facilitators focus on the foundations of adult education : establish existing knowledge , build on it and keep it relevant . The role is different from a trainer with subject expertise .

This included having to fly in bad weather as well
as good , for which the USAAF had not previously carried out much training . During the first weeks of the mail service , nearly a dozen Army pilots were killed . The Army Air Force hierarchy remembered Ed Link and his trainer .

=== World War I ( 1914–18 ) === === The 1920s and
1930s === Initially , aviation flight schools showed little interest in the " Link Trainer " .

The result was that the USAAF purchased six Link Trainers , and
this can be said to mark the start of the world flight simulation industry . === World War II ( 1939–1945 ) === The principal pilot trainer used during World War II was the Link Trainer .

The principal pilot trainer used during World War II was the Link
Trainer . Some 10,000 were produced to train 500,000 new pilots from allied nations , many in the USA and Canada because many pilots were trained in those countries before returning to Europe or the Pacific to fly combat missions . Almost all US Army Air Force pilots were trained in a Link Trainer .

=== Training
for pilots === Several different devices are utilized in modern flight training . Cockpit Procedures Trainer ( CPT ) are used to practice basic cockpit procedures , such as processing emergency checklists , and for cockpit familiarization .

The result was
that the USAAF purchased six Link Trainers , and this can be said to mark the start of the world flight simulation industry . === World War II ( 1939–1945 ) === The principal pilot trainer used during World War II was the Link Trainer .

Almost all US
Army Air Force pilots were trained in a Link Trainer . A different type of World War II trainer was used for navigating at night by the stars . The Celestial Navigation Trainer of 1941 was 13.7 m ( 45 ft ) high and capable of accommodating the navigation team of a bomber crew .

=== The 1920s and
1930s === Initially , aviation flight schools showed little interest in the " Link Trainer " . Link also demonstrated his trainer to the U.S. Army Air Force ( USAAF ) , but with no result .

Full Flight Simulators (
FFS ) ==== European Aviation Safety Agency ( EASA , ex JAA ) ==== Flight Navigation and Procedures Trainer ( FNPT )

Some 10,000 were produced to train 500,000
new pilots from allied nations , many in the USA and Canada because many pilots were trained in those countries before returning to Europe or the Pacific to fly combat missions . Almost all US Army Air Force pilots were trained in a Link Trainer . A different type of World War II trainer was used for navigating at night by the stars .

The Army Air Force hierarchy remembered Ed Link and
his trainer . Link flew in to meet them at Newark Field in New Jersey , and they were impressed by his ability to arrive on a day with poor visibility , due to practice on his training device . The result was that the USAAF purchased six Link Trainers , and this can be said to mark the start of the world flight simulation industry .
